positive: Show the object clearly in a three-quarters view with the full object visible and centered. Use a neutral, solid background with strong contrast to the object. Remove all background elements, text, logos, and watermarks. Preserve the original object category, geometry, proportions, and structure exactly as shown. Keep original colors and materials without enhancement. Ensure sharp edges, clear contours, accurate perspective, and realistic surface detail. Aim for a neutral, scan-like reference suitable for precise 3D reconstruction.
negative: wrong object category, changed function, added or missing parts, altered proportions, exaggerated features, stylization, artistic style, cartoon, painterly, sketch, abstract, conceptual art, symmetry correction, geometry smoothing, shape distortion, inflated or shrunken parts, decorative details not present, dramatic lighting, cinematic lighting, harsh shadows, reflections, depth of field, bokeh, environmental scene, complex background, cropped object, partial view, occlusion, incorrect perspective, blurry, motion blur, low contrast, overexposed, underexposed, color shifting, material substitution, texture hallucination, noise, artifacts
